If you do not do so, then there will be turmoil (Fitnah) in the land and discord (Fasad). If you do not do so, then there will be turmoil (Fitnah) in the land and discord (Fasad)." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! What if there was something about him?"
He said: "When someone whose religion and character you are pleased with comes to you then marry him." (And he (pbuh) said this) three times.
question: Why might the Prophet Muhammad have emphasized the importance of marrying someone with good character multiple times?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Indeed the woman is married for her religion, her wealth, and her beauty, so take the one with religion, and may your hands be dusty."
question: What does the phrase 'may your hands be dusty' imply in the context of choosing a spouse?

hadith-eng: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah proposed to a woman, so the Prophet said: "Look at her, for indeed that is more likely to make things better between the two of you."
question: What are the benefits of mutual understanding before marriage according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The distinction between the lawful and the unlawful  is the Duff and the voice."
question: What is the role of cultural expressions such as music and voice in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Publicize this marriage, and hold it in the Masjid, and beat the Duff for it."
question: What are the cultural practices associated with Islamic weddings?

hadith-eng: "The morning after the consummation of my marriage, the Prophet came and sat on my bed as far from me as you are sitting now, and our little girls started beating the Duff and reciting verses mourning my father who had been killed in the battle of Badr. One of them said: 'Among us is a Prophet who knows what will happen tomorrow.' On that the Prophet said: 'Stop saying this, and keep on saying what you were saying before.'"
question: What role do cultural practices play in Islamic celebrations according to this narration?

hadith-eng: When supplicating for the newlywed, the Prophet would say: (Barak Allahu laka wa baraka alaik, wa jama'a bainakuma fi khair.) "May Allah bless you and send blessings upon you, and bring goodness between you."
question: How can supplications contribute to the success and harmony of a marriage?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "If anyone of you, when having sexual intercourse with his wife, says: (Bismillah, Allahumma jannibnash-Shaitana wa jannibish-Shaitana ma razaqtana) 'In the Name of Allah, O Allah! Protect me from Shaitan and protect what you bestow upon us from Shaitan' - then if Allah decrees that they should have a child, Shaitan will not be able to harm him.'"
question: How does the invocation of Allah's protection influence the spiritual well-being of a family?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah saw some traces of saffron on `Abdur-Rahman bin `Awf so he said: 'What is this?' He said: 'I married a woman for the amount of gold equal to a date stone.' So he said: 'May Allah bless you. Have a banquet, even if with only one sheep.'"
question: What role does the Prophet (ï·º) play in guiding companions on marital matters?

question: How does the inclusion or exclusion of certain narrators impact the understanding of a hadith?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Having food on the first day is was is obligatory, and having food on the second day is Sunnah, and having food on the third day is to be heard of, and whoever wants to be heard of, Allah will make him heard of."
question: How does this teaching differentiate between obligatory acts and Sunnah?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Accept the invitation when you are offered."
question: What might be the consequences of refusing invitations in an Islamic context?

hadith-eng: "A man named Abu Shu'aib came to a slave of his, who was a butcher, and said: 'Prepare some food for me that will be sufficient for five, for I have seen hunger in the face of the Messenger of Allah.' So he prepared some food. Then he sent a message to the Prophet inviting him and those who were sitting with him. When the Prophet stood, he was followed by a man who was not with them when they were invited. When the Messenger of Allah arrive at the door he said to the owner of the house: 'A man who was not with us when you invited us followed us, if you permit him, he will enter.'" He said: We have permitted him, let him enter."
question: What does this narration teach about the importance of communication and consent in social gatherings?

hadith-eng: "I married a woman and went to the Prophet, he said: 'O Jabir! Have you married?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'A virgin or a matron?' I said: 'A matron.' He said: 'Why didn't you marry a young girl, so that you may play with her and she with you?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Abdullah (his father) died and left behind seven - or nine - daughter, so I have brought someone who can look after them.'" (He said:) "So he supplicated for me."
question: What is the significance of the Prophet's supplication for Jabir in this context?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no marriage except with a Wali."
question: Who can be considered a Wali in an Islamic marriage?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whichever woman married without the permission of her Wali her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid. If he entered into her, then the Mahr is for her in lieu of what he enjoyed from her private part. If they disagree, then the Sultan is the Wali for one who has no Wali."
question: How does Islamic law address disputes regarding the validity of a marriage without a Wali?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "The adulteresses are the ones who marry themselves without Bayyinah (proof)."
question: What role does Bayyinah play in validating a marriage in Islam?

question: How does the Tashah-hud address the guidance and misguidance of individuals?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "A matron should not be given in marriage until she is consulted, and a virgin should not be given in marriage until her permission is sought, and her silence is her permission."
question: How does this teaching reflect the respect for women's autonomy in marriage decisions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The matron has more right to herself than her Wali, and the virgin is to give permission for herself, and her silence is her permission."
question: How does Islamic law ensure the autonomy of women in marriage decisions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "An orphan is to be consulted about herself, then if she is silent that is her permission, and if she refuses, then do not authorize it (the marriage) for her" (meaning: when she attains the age of puberty and refuses it.)
question: How does Islamic law protect the rights of orphan girls in matters of marriage?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whichever woman is given in marriage by two Wali, then her case is in accordance with the first of them, and whoever sells something to two men, then it is for the first of them."
question: What is the importance of the first agreement in Islamic transactions and contracts?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whichever slave gets married without the permission of his owner, then he is a fornicator."
question: What does Islamic tradition say about the relationship between a slave's marital status and their owner's authority?

hadith-eng: Abdullah narrated that the Prophet said: "Whichever slave gets married without the permission of his owner, then he is a fornicator."
question: What does Islamic tradition say about the moral implications of a slave marrying without consent?

hadith-eng: "A woman from Banu Fazarah was married for (the dowry of) two sandals. So the Messenger of Allah said to her: 'Do you approve of (exchanging) yourself and your wealth for two sandals?' She said: 'Yes.'" He said: "So he permitted it."
question: What can be inferred about the cultural practices of dowry during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ï·º)?

hadith-eng: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah and said: "I present myself to you (for marriage)." So she stood for a long time. Then a man said: "O Messenger of Allah! Marry her to me if you have no need of her." So he said: "Do you have anything to give her as a dowry?"  He said: "I have nothing except this Izar." So the Messenger of Allah said: "If you give her your Izar then you will have no Izar, so search for something." He said: "I did not find anything." He said: "Search for something, even if it just an iron ring." He said: So he searched but he did not find anything. The Messenger of Allah said: "Do you have any Qur'an (memorized)?" He said: "Yes. This Surat and that Surat." And he named the Surat. So the Messenger of Allah said: "I marry her to you for what you have (memorized) of the Qur'an."
question: How does this story illustrate the Prophet's approach to facilitating marriage?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah emancipated Safiyyah and he made her emancipation her dowry."
question: What are the rights of a woman in an Islamic marriage concerning dowry?

hadith-eng: "Three will receive their reward twice: A slave who fulfills the rights of Allah and the rights of his owners, then he will be given his reward twice. And a man who has a beautiful slave girl, so he teaches her good manners, then he frees her, then he married her seeking the Face of Allah by that; then he will be given his reward twice. And a man who believed in an earlier Book, then another Book came to him and he believed in it; then he will be given his reward twice."
question: What actions can lead to receiving a double reward in the context of Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whichever man married a woman and entered into her, then it is not lawful for him to marry her daughter. If he did not enter into her then he may marry her daughter. And whichever man married a woman and he entered into her, or he did  not enter into her, then it is not lawful for him to marry her mother."
question: What are the rules regarding marrying a woman's mother in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "The wife of Rifa'ah Al-Qurzi came to the Messenger of Allah and said: 'I was with Rifa'ah and he divorced me irrevocably. Then I married Abdur-Rahman bin Az-Zubair, but he only has the likes of the fringe of a garment.' So he said: 'Perhaps you want me to return to Rifa'ah? No, not until you taste his sweetness, and he tastes your sweetness.'"
question: How does Islamic jurisprudence handle cases of remarriage after divorce?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah cursed the Muhill and the one the Muhallal was done for."
question: What ethical considerations are highlighted by the Prophet's curse on certain marital practices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah cursed the Muhill and the one the Muhallal was done for."
question: How does the concept of curse in Islam affect the actions and decisions of Muslims in their daily lives?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prohibited the Mut'ah with women, and the meat of domestic donkeys during (the campaign of) Khaibar."
question: How do prohibitions in Islam relate to the well-being and social order of the community?

hadith-eng: Ibn Abbas said: "Mut'ah was only during the beginning of Islam. A man would arrive in a land that he was not familiar with so he would marry a woman for the extent of time that he thought he would remain there. So his Mut'ah was upheld and his case was fine until the (following) Ayah was revealed: Except their wives or what their right hands possess. Then every private part other than those became unlawful."
question: What are the implications of the prohibition of Mut'ah on Islamic marital laws?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "There is no Jalab, no Janab, and no Shighar in Islam. And whoever takes some property by force, then he is not from us."
question: What are the ethical implications of taking property by force according to Islamic principles?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prohibited Shighar."
question: How does Islamic jurisprudence address unconventional marriage practices?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prohibited marrying a woman along with her paternal aunt or along with her maternal aunt."
question: What guidance does Islam provide regarding familial relationships in marriage?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited that a woman be married along with her paternal aunt, or the paternal aunt along with her brother's daughter, or a woman with her maternal aunt, or the maternal aunt along with her sister's daughter, and the younger is not to be married with the older, nor the older with the younger."
question: What are the implications of marrying a younger woman with an older woman in the same family?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed the conditions most deserving to be fulfilled are those that make the private parts lawful among you."
question: Why is it important to honor agreements that involve personal and private matters in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Ghilan bin Salamah Ath-Thaqafi accepted Islam and he had ten wives in Jahiliyyah who accepted Islam along with him. So the Prophet ordered (him) to chose four (of them)."
question: How does this narration reflect the Prophet's role in guiding new converts in their personal affairs?

hadith-eng: He heard Ibn Fairuz Ad-Dhailami narrating from his father: "I went to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I accepted Islam and I had two sisters (as wives).' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Chose whichever of them you will.'"
question: How does Islamic law prioritize the choice between two closely related spouses?

question: How does Islamic law prioritize choices in marital relationships when conflicts arise?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, then he does not levy his water on someone else's child."
question: What ethical guidelines does Islam provide regarding family and social responsibilities?

hadith-eng: "We got some captives on the day of Awtas, and they had husbands among their peopled. They mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah, so the following was revealed: And women who are already married, except those whom your right hands posses.
question: How does the revelation impact the understanding of marital rights in the context of war captives?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited the price of a dog, the dowry of a fornicator, and the payment made to the fortune-teller."
question: What are some examples of prohibited earnings in Islamic law?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "A man is not to sell over his brother's sale, nor is he to propose to whom his brother has proposed."
question: What are the consequences of violating the principles of fairness in sales and proposals according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman and I visited Fatimah bint Qais. She narrated to us that her husband had divorced her three times, and he did not leave her with anywhere to live nor any wealth. She said: 'He left ten Aqfizah for me with the son of his uncle: five were of barley, five of wheat.' She said: 'I went to the Messenger of Allah and mentioned that to him.' She said: 'He said: 'He is correct.'" (She said: ) 'So he ordered me to complete my Iddah in the home of Umm Sharik. But then the Messenger of Allah said to me: "Umm Sharik's home is visited by Muhajirun, so spend your Iddah in the home of Ibn Umm Maktum, for there you can remove your garments and he will not see you. Then when your Iddah is completed and someone proposed to you come to me." 'So when my Iddah completed. Abu Jahm and Mu'awiyah proposed to me.' She said: 'I went to the Messenger of Allah and mentioned that to him, and he said: "As for Mu'awiyah, he is a man with no wealth,  and as for Abu Jahm he is a man who is harsh with women." She said: 'Then Usamah bin Zaid proposed to me, and he married me. So Allah blessed me with Usamah.'"
question: How does the hadith illustrate the Prophet Muhammad's (ï·º) concern for the well-being and safety of women?

hadith-eng: "We said: 'O Messenger of Allah! We practice Azl, but the Jews claim that it is minor infanticide.'  So he said: 'The Jews lie. When Allah wants to create it, nothing can prevent Him.'"
question: What is the significance of refuting false claims in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "We practiced Azl while the Qur'an was being revealed."
question: How did the companions of the Prophet approach the practice of Azl?

hadith-eng: He (Abu Qilabah) said: "If I wish, I could say: 'The Messenger of Allah said'" but he said: "The Sunnah when a man married a virgin after he already has a wife, is that he stays with her seven (nights). And when he married a matron when he already has a wife, he stays with her three (nights)."
question: What are the differences in the time allocation for a husband marrying a virgin versus a matron?

hadith-eng: The Prophet would divide (his time) equally between his wives and said: "O Allah! This is my division in what I have control over, so do not punish me for what You have control over which I do not have control over."
question: Why is it important to acknowledge the limits of human control in seeking fairness?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When a man has two wives and he is not just between them, he will come on the Day of Judgment with one side drooping."
question: How is the concept of justice between spouses addressed in Islamic eschatology?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah returned his daughter Zainab to Abul-As bin Ar-Rabi with a new dowry and a new wedding."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet Muhammad's (ï·º) family life from this event?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet returned his daughter Zainab to Abul-As bin Ar-Rabi after six years in the first marriage without renewing the marriage."
question: What are the implications of this event for understanding the rules of marriage in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "A man became a Muslim during the time of the Prophet, then his wife became a Muslim, so he said: 'O Messenger of Allah! She accepted Islam along with me, so return her to me.' So he returned her to him."
question: How does Islamic law address the situation when both husband and wife convert to Islam?

hadith-eng: Ibn Mas'ud was asked about a man who married a woman and he did not stipulate the dowry for her, and he did not enter into her until he died. So Ibn Mas'ud said: "She gets the same dowry as other women, no less and no more, she has to observe the Iddah, and she gets inheritance." So Ma'qil bin Sinan Al-Ashja'I stood and said: "The Messenger of Allah judged the same as you have judged regarding Birwa bint Washiq, a woman of ours." So Ibn Mas'ud was happy about that.
question: How does the judgment of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) influence the rulings of the companions in similar cases?
